alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 8:18PM EST until March 08 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...Missouri... Mississippi River at New Madrid .Runoff from recent heavy rains across the Ohio River Valley will cause the Mississippi River at New Madrid to rise into minor flood stage this week. The river will reach flood stage Tuesday morning and crest near 34.5 feet Friday morning. For the Mississippi River...including New Madrid...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY, MARCH 08... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at New Madrid. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Tuesday, March 08. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 33.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Tuesday morning to a crest of 34.5 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, March 07. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
